intro: Cynoglossospermum echinophorum, commonly known as the spiny tongueplant, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its spiny, lance-shaped leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and dry fields. Due to its adaptability and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in xeriscapes and native plant gardens.
